Know Your Numbers About 40 percent of men are worried about their weight , a new study in BMC Public Health found. But many guys don’t really know what they’re working with: About 1 in 5 guys underestimate their weight, and that number only grows the heavier they are. Twenty-nine percent of overweight men underestimate their weight, as do 45 percent of obese guys. 
Lower Your Blood Pressure A new discovery may help treat hypertension. Researchers from King’s College London found that a drug that prevents the production of nitric oxide in your nerves may help lower your blood pressure. This new drug may provide hope for people’s whose high blood pressure is poorly controlled by traditional treatment methods. 
Make Some Friends All your friends on social media might not be doing you much good in real life. The more time you spend on social media, the more likely you are to feel socially isolated , a new study of young adults from the University of Pittsburgh found. People who spent more than two hours a day on platforms like Facebook, YouTube, and Twitter were twice as likely to feel isolated than those who spent less than a half hour a day scrolling. 
Protect Your Head Trauma to your head can have long-term consequences: Researchers from UCLA discovered that head injuries can trigger changes in 268 genes , more than 100 of which have been linked to neurological and psychiatric disorders. Now, the study was done on mice, but the researchers say that the genes that were found to be altered after the head injury have counterparts in the human body.
